</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	CHECK POINT SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;2:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company records a provision for estimated sales returns, stock rotations and other
	rights to customers on product and service related sales in the same period the related revenues are recorded. These estimates are based on historical sales returns, analysis of credit memo data, stock rotation and other known factors. Such
	provisions amounted to $ 14,130 and $&nbsp;14,618 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	m.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Cost of revenues:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cost of products and licenses is comprised of cost of software and hardware
	production, manuals, packaging and shipping.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cost of subscriptions is comprised of license fees paid to third parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cost of software updates and maintenance is mainly comprised of cost of post-sale customer support.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Amortization of technology is comprised of amortization of core technology assets which are used in the Company&#146;s operations, and is
	presented separately as part of cost of revenues.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	n.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Severance pay:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s liability for severance pay for periods prior to
	January&nbsp;1, 2007, is calculated pursuant to Israeli severance pay law based on the most recent salary of the employees multiplied by the number of years of employment as of the balance sheet date. The Company recorded as expenses the increase in
	the severance liability, net of earnings (losses) from the related investment fund. Employees were entitled to one month&#146;s salary for each year of employment, or a portion thereof. Until January&nbsp;1, 2007, the Company&#146;s liability was
	partially funded by monthly payments deposited with insurers; any unfunded amounts are covered by a provision established by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The carrying value of deposited funds in respect to the severance liability for services prior to January&nbsp;1, 2007, includes profits
	(losses) accumulated up to the balance sheet date. The deposited funds may be withdrawn only upon the fulfillment of the obligation pursuant to Israeli severance pay law or labor agreements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Effective January&nbsp;1, 2007, the Company&#146;s agreements with employees in Israel, are under Section&nbsp;14 of the Severance Pay Law,
	1963. The Company&#146;s contributions for severance pay have replaced its severance obligation. Upon contribution of the full amount of the employee&#146;s monthly salary for each year of service, no additional calculations is conducted between the
	parties regarding the matter of severance pay and no additional payments is made by the Company to the employee. Further, the related obligation and amounts deposited on behalf of the employee for such obligation are not stated on the balance sheet,
	as the Company is legally released from the obligation to employees once the deposit amounts have been paid. Severance expenses for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, were $ 7,140, $ 6,726 and $ 5,987, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-17
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;2:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	o.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Employee benefit plan:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has a 401(K) defined contribution plan covering certain
	employees in the U.S. In 2015, all eligible employees may elect to contribute up to 50%, but generally not greater than $&nbsp;18 per year (and an additional amount of $&nbsp;6 for employees aged 50 and over), of their annual compensation to the
	plan through salary deferrals, subject to IRS limits. The Company matches 50% of employee contributions to the plan up to a limit of 3% of their eligible compensation. In 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company&#146;s matching contribution to the plan
	amounted to $ 1,397, $&nbsp;1,148 and $&nbsp;1,073, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	p.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Income taxes:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company accounts for income taxes in accordance with ASC No.&nbsp;740,
	&#147;Income Taxes&#148; (&#147;ASC No.&nbsp;740&#148;). ASC No.&nbsp;740 prescribes the use of the liability method whereby deferred tax asset and liability account balances are determined for temporary differences between financial reporting and
	tax bases of assets and liabilities and are measured using the enacted tax rates and laws that will be in effect when the differences are expected to reverse. The Company provides a valuation allowance, if necessary, to reduce deferred tax assets to
	amounts more likely than not to be realized.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	ASC No.&nbsp;740 contains a two-step approach to recognizing and measuring a liability for
	uncertain tax positions. The first step is to evaluate the tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return by determining if the weight of available evidence indicates that it is more likely than not that, on an evaluation of the
	technical merits, the tax position will be sustained on audit, including resolution of any related appeals or litigation processes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	second step is to measure the tax benefit as the largest amount that is more than 50% (cumulative basis) likely to be realized upon ultimate settlement. The Company classifies interest related to unrecognized tax benefits in taxes on income.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	q.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Advertising costs:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Advertising costs are expensed as incurred. Advertising expenses for the
	years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, were $ 2,311, $&nbsp;2,837 and $&nbsp;4,260, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	r.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Concentrations of credit risk:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Financial instruments that potentially subject the Company to
	concentrations of credit risk consist principally of cash and cash equivalents, short-term bank deposits, marketable securities, trade receivables and foreign currency derivative contracts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-18
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage87"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<A HREF="#D121681D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	CHECK POINT SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;2:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The majority of the Company&#146;s cash and cash equivalents and short-term bank deposits
	are deposited in major banks in the U.S., Israel and Europe. Deposits in the U.S. may be in excess of insured limits and are not insured in other jurisdictions. Generally, these deposits may be withdrawn upon demand and therefore bear low risk.
	Marketable securities are held mainly by the Company&#146;s Singaporean subsidiary, the U.S. subsidiary and Check Point Ltd., and are invested in securities denominated in U.S. dollar.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s marketable securities consist of investments in government, corporate and government sponsored enterprises debentures. The
	Company&#146;s investment policy, approved by the Board of Directors, limits the amount that the Company may invest in any one type of investment or issuer, thereby reducing credit risk concentrations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s trade receivables are geographically dispersed and derived from sales to channel partners mainly in the United States,
	Europe and Asia. Concentration of credit risk with respect to trade receivables is limited by credit limits, ongoing credit evaluation and account monitoring procedures. The Company performs ongoing credit evaluations of its channel partners and
	establishes an allowance for doubtful accounts based on factors that may affect a customers&#146; ability to pay, such as age of the receivable balance and past experience. Allowance for doubtful accounts amounted to $&nbsp;2,101 and $&nbsp;3,928 as
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The Company writes off receivables when they are deemed uncollectible, having exhausted all collection efforts. Actual collection experience may not meet expectations and may result in increased bad
	debt expense. Bad debt income amounted to ($ 1,834), $&nbsp;(1,932) and $&nbsp;(1,090) in 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively. Total write offs during 2015, 2014 and 2013 amounted to $ 123, $&nbsp;1,537 and $&nbsp;668, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company utilizes forward contracts to protect against the risk of overall changes in exchange rates. The derivative instruments hedge a
	portion of the Company&#146;s non-dollar currency exposure. Counterparties to the Company&#146;s derivative instruments are all major financial institutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-19
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage88"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<A HREF="#D121681D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	CHECK POINT SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;2:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	s.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Derivatives and hedging:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company accounts for derivatives and hedging based on ASC
	No.&nbsp;815, &#147;Derivatives and Hedging&#148; (&#147;ASC No.&nbsp;815&#148;). ASC No.&nbsp;815 requires the Company to recognize all derivatives on the balance sheet at fair value. The accounting for changes in the fair value (i.e., gains or
	losses) of a derivative instrument depends on whether it has been designated and qualifies as part of a hedging relationship, as well as the type of hedging relationship. For those derivative instruments that are designated and qualify as hedging
	instruments, the Company must designate the hedging instrument, based upon the exposure being hedged, as a fair value hedge, cash flow hedge, or a hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation. If the derivatives meet the definition of a hedge
	and are designated as such, depending on the nature of the hedge, changes in the fair value of such derivatives will either be offset against the change in fair value of the hedged assets, liabilities, or firm commitments through earnings, or
	recognized in other comprehensive income until the hedged item is recognized in earnings. The ineffective portion of a derivative&#146;s change in fair value is recognized in financial income, net.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company entered into forward contracts to hedge the fair value of assets and liabilities denominated in New Israeli Shekels, Euros,
	British Pounds, Swedish Krona, Japanese Yen, Czech Koruna and Canadian Dollar. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company had outstanding forward contracts that did not meet the requirement for hedge accounting, in the notional amount of $
	319,380 and $&nbsp;250,946, respectively. The Company measured the fair value of the contracts in accordance with ASC No.&nbsp;820, &#147;Fair Value Measurement&#148; (&#147;ASC No.&nbsp;820&#148;) (classified as level 2). The net gains (losses)
	resulting from these forward contracts recognized in financial income, net during 2015, 2014 and 2013 were $ 378, $&nbsp;(21,970) and $&nbsp;20,306, respectively. The fair value of the Company&#146;s outstanding forward contracts at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 amounted to liabilities of $ 52 and $&nbsp;88, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company entered into forward contracts
	to hedge against the risk of overall changes in future cash flow from payments of payroll and related expenses denominated in New Israeli Shekels. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company had outstanding forward contracts in the notional
	amount of $ 25,732 and $&nbsp;38,784, respectively. These contracts were for a period of up to twelve months. The Company measured the fair value of the contracts in accordance with ASC No.&nbsp;820 (classified as level 2). These contracts met the
	requirement for cash flow hedge accounting and, as such, gains (losses) on the contracts are recognized initially in OCI and reclassified to the statement of income in the period the related hedged items affect earnings. During 2015, 2014 and 2013
	gains (losses) in the amount of $ (1,585), $&nbsp;(3,009) and $&nbsp;2,366, respectively, were reclassified when the related expenses were incurred and recognized in operating expenses. The fair value of the Company&#146;s outstanding forward
	contracts at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 amounted to assets (liabilities) of $ 8 and $ (2,854), respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-20
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	t.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Basic and diluted earnings per share:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Basic earnings per share are computed based on the
	weighted average number of ordinary shares outstanding during each year. Diluted earnings per share is computed based on the weighted average number of ordinary shares outstanding during each year, plus dilutive potential ordinary shares outstanding
	during the year, in accordance with ASC No.&nbsp;260, &#147;Earnings Per Share&#148;.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The total weighted average number of shares related
	to the outstanding options excluded from the calculations of diluted earnings per share, since it would have an anti-dilutive effect, was 1,594,082, 1,746,613 and 5,694,945 for 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	u.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Accounting for stock-based compensation:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company accounts for stock-based compensation in
	accordance with ASC No.&nbsp;718, &#147;Compensation-Stock Compensation&#148; (&#147;ASC No.&nbsp;718&#148;). ASC No.&nbsp;718 requires companies to estimate the fair value of equity-based payment awards on the grant date using an option-pricing
	model. The value of the portion of the award that is ultimately expected to vest is recognized as an expense over the requisite service periods in the Company&#146;s consolidated statements of income.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company recognizes compensation expenses for the value of awards granted, based on the straight line method for service based awards and
	based on the accelerated method for performance-based awards. Compensation expense is recognized over the requisite service period of the awards, net of estimated forfeitures. ASC No.&nbsp;718 requires forfeitures to be estimated at the time of
	grant and revised, if necessary, in subsequent periods if actual forfeitures differ from those estimates. Estimated forfeitures are based on actual historical pre-vesting forfeitures.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company selected the Black-Scholes-Merton option pricing model as the most appropriate model for determining the fair value method for its
	stock options awards and Employee Stock Purchase Plan, whereas the fair value of restricted stock units is based on the market value of the underlying shares at the date of grant. The option-pricing model requires a number of assumptions, the most
	significant of which are the expected stock price volatility and the expected option term. Expected volatility was calculated based upon actual historical stock price movements over the most recent periods ending on the grant date, equal to the
	expected term of the options. The expected term of options granted is based upon historical experience and represents the period of time between when the options are granted and when they are expected to be exercised. The risk-free interest rate is
	based on the yield from U.S. treasury bonds with an equivalent term to the expected term of the options. The Company has historically not paid dividends and has no plans to pay dividends in the foreseeable future.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-21
</P>

	The fair value of options granted and Employee Stock Purchase Plan in 2015, 2014 and 2013 is
	estimated at the date of grant using the following weighted average assumptions:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;

</TD>

</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	v.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Fair value of financial instruments:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company measures its investments in money market
	funds classified as cash equivalents, marketable securities and its foreign currency derivative contracts at fair value. Fair value is an exit price, representing the amount that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in
	an orderly transaction between market participants. A three-tier fair value hierarchy is established as a basis for considering such assumptions and for inputs used in the valuation methodologies in measuring fair value:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_30"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="14%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="78%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Level&nbsp;1&nbsp;-
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Valuations based on quoted prices in active markets for identical assets that the Company has the ability to access. Since valuations are based on quoted prices that are readily and regularly available in an active market,
	valuation of these products does not entail a significant degree of judgment.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Level 2 -
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Valuations based on one or more quoted prices in markets that are not active or for which all significant inputs are observable, either directly or indirectly.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Level 3 -
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	Valuations based on inputs that are unobservable and significant to the overall fair value measurement.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The fair value hierarchy also requires an entity to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use
	of unobservable inputs when measuring fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-22
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage91"></A>

<B>
	CHECK POINT SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES LTD.
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;2:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	w.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Comprehensive income:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company accounts for comprehensive income in accordance with ASC
	No.&nbsp;220, &#147;Comprehensive Income&#148;. Comprehensive income generally represents all changes in shareholders&#146; equity during the period except those resulting from investments by, or distributions to, shareholders. The Company
	determined that its items of other comprehensive income relate to gains and losses on hedging derivative instruments and unrealized gains and losses on available-for-sale marketable securities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table shows the components of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss), net of taxes, for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	*)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The reclassification out of accumulated other comprehensive income during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 for realized gains on marketable securities are included within financial income, net.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	**)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The reclassification out of accumulated other comprehensive income during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 for realized losses on cash flow hedges are included mostly within research and development expenses as
	well as other operating expenses.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	x.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Treasury shares:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company repurchases its ordinary shares from time to time on the open
	market and holds such shares as treasury shares. The Company presents the cost to repurchase treasury stock as a separate component of shareholders&#146; equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company reissues treasury shares under the stock purchase plan, upon exercise of options and upon vesting of restricted stock units.
	Reissuance of treasury shares is accounted for in accordance with ASC No.&nbsp;505-30 whereby gains are credited to additional paid-in capital and losses are charged to additional paid-in capital to the extent that previous net gains are included
	therein; otherwise to retained earnings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-23
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage92"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D121681D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	CHECK POINT SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;2:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	y.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Legal contingencies:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company is currently involved in various claims and legal
	proceedings. The Company reviews the status of each matter and assesses its potential financial exposure. If the potential loss from any claim or legal proceeding is considered probable and the amount can be reasonably estimated, the Company accrues
	a liability for the estimated loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	z.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Impact of recently issued accounting standards:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In May 2014, the Financial Accounting
	Standards Board (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued an ASU No.&nbsp;2014-09 on revenue from contracts with customers, which outlines a single comprehensive model for entities to use in accounting for revenue arising from contracts with customers and
	supersedes most current revenue recognition guidance. In 2015, the FASB issued guidance to defer the effective date to fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017 with early adoption for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016.
	The Company is currently evaluating the method of adoption, as well as the effect that adoption of this ASU will have on its consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In November 2015, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2015-17 related to balance sheet classification of deferred taxes.&nbsp;The new guidance
	requires that deferred tax assets and liabilities be classified as noncurrent in a classified statement of financial position. The new guidance is effective for fiscal years, and interim periods within those fiscal years, beginning after
	December&nbsp;15, 2016. Early adoption is permitted. The Company early adopted this guidance on a retrospective basis as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. As a result, the Company&#146;s current deferred tax assets as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 in an amount
	of $34,175 were reclassified to noncurrent assets to conform to the current year presentation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	February 2016, the FASB issued ASU
	2016-02, &#147;Leases&#148; (Topic 842), whereby, lessees will be required to recognize for all leases at the commencement date a lease liability, which is a lessee&#145;s obligation to make lease payments arising from a lease, measured on a
	discounted basis; and a right-of-use asset, which is an asset that represents the lessee&#146;s right to use, or control the use of, a specified asset for the lease term. Under the new guidance, lessor accounting is largely unchanged. A modified
	retrospective transition approach for leases existing at, or entered into after, the beginning of the earliest comparative period presented in the financial statements must be applied. The modified retrospective approach would not require any
	transition accounting for leases that expired before the earliest comparative period presented. Companies may not apply a full retrospective transition approach. ASU 2016-02 is effective for annual and interim periods beginning after
	December&nbsp;15, 2018. Early application is permitted. The Company is evaluating the potential impact of this pronouncement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-24
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

</H5>

	CHECK POINT SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;2:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In March 2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No.&nbsp;2016-09,
	&#147;Compensation &#151; Stock Compensation (Topic 718): Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment Accounting&#148; (&#147;ASU 2016-09&#148;). ASU 2016-09 simplifies several aspects of the accounting for share-based payment transactions,
	including the income tax consequences, classification of awards as either equity or liabilities, and classification on the statement of cash flows. For public entities, ASU 2016-09 is effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15,
	2016, and interim periods within those fiscal years. Early adoption is permitted. We are currently evaluating the potential impact of adopting this guidance on our consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;3:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	ACQUISITIONS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On February&nbsp;17, 2015, the Company completed the acquisition of Hyperwise Ltd, a privately-held Israeli-based company.
	Under the acquisition method of accounting, the purchase price was allocated to tangible and intangible assets acquired and liabilities assumed based on their respective fair values. In addition, the transaction included additional consideration
	related to compensation for post combination services which was recorded as prepaid expenses and will be recognized over the requisite service period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On April&nbsp;2, 2015, the Company completed the acquisition of Lacoon Mobile Security Ltd, a privately held Israeli based company. Under the
	acquisition method of accounting, the purchase price was allocated to tangible and intangible assets acquired and liabilities assumed based on their respective fair values. In addition, the transaction included additional consideration related to
	compensation for post combination services which was recorded as prepaid expenses and will be recognized over the requisite service period.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	These acquisitions were not significant individually or in the aggregate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, interest receivable amounted to $ 17,754 and $&nbsp;17,864
	respectively, and is included within other current assets in the balance sheets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-26
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;5:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with ASC No.&nbsp;820, the Company
	measures its money market funds, marketable securities and foreign currency derivative contracts at fair value. Money market funds and marketable securities are classified within Level 1 or Level 2. This is because these assets are valued using
	quoted market prices or alternative pricing sources and models utilizing market observable inputs. Foreign currency derivative contracts are classified within Level 2 as the valuation inputs are based on quoted prices and market observable data of
	similar instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s financial assets measured at fair value on a recurring basis, excluding accrued interest
	components, consisted of the following types of instruments as of the following dates:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, employees and payroll accruals include a total amount of $ 2,568 and $&nbsp;3,214,
	respectively, related to payroll accrued for the benefit of certain related parties since 2002 until 2007.

	Table of Contents

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	CHECK POINT SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES LTD.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">

	agreements, which expire on various dates, the latest of which is in 2020. The Company recognizes rent expense under such arrangements on a straight-line basis.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Rent expenses for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, were $ 8,287, $&nbsp;6,570 and
	$&nbsp;6,224 respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Litigations:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company operates its business in various countries, and accordingly attempts
	to utilize an efficient operating model to structure its tax payments based on the laws in the countries in which the Company operates. This can cause disputes between the Company and various tax authorities in different parts of the world.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Further, the Company is the defendant in various other lawsuits, including employment-related litigation claims, construction claims and other
	legal proceedings in the normal course of its business. Litigation and governmental proceedings can be expensive, lengthy and disruptive to normal business operations, and can require extensive management attention and resources, regardless of their
	merit. While the Company intends to defend the aforementioned matters vigorously, it believes that a loss in excess of its accrued liability with respect to these claims is not probable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-31
</P>

	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;12:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	TAXES ON INCOME
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Israeli taxation:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Corporate tax:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:19%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company elected to apply the Preferred Enterprise regime under the Law for
	the Encouragement of Capital Investment (the &#147;Investment Law&#148;). Under the Preferred Enterprise regime, the Company&#146;s entire preferred income is subject to tax rates as follows: 2013 - 12.5% and 2014 and thereafter - 16%. The election
	is irrevocable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:19%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Income not eligible for Preferred Enterprise benefits are taxed at a regular rate, as follows: 2015 and 2014 &#150; 26.5%
	and for 2013 - 25%.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:19%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;4, 2016, an amendment to the Israeli tax ordinance was enacted such that commencing January&nbsp;1,
	2016, the Israeli regular tax rate will be reduced from 26.5% to 25%. The effect of the change in tax rates will result in a decrease in deferred tax balances in immaterial amounts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:19%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Prior to 2012, most of the Company&#146;s income was exempt from tax or subject to reduced tax rates under the Investment Law. Upon
	distribution of exempt income, the distributing company will be subject to corporate reduced tax rates ordinarily applicable to such income under the Investment Law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:19%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Reduced income under the Investment Law including the Preferred Enterprise Regime will be freely distributable as dividends, subject to a
	15%-20% withholding tax (or lower, under an applicable tax treaty). However, upon the distribution of a dividend from Preferred Income to an Israeli company, no withholding tax will be remitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:19%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Pursuant to a temporary tax relief initiated by the Israeli government, a company that elected by November&nbsp;11, 2013 to pay a reduced
	corporate tax rate as set forth in the temporary tax relief with respect to undistributed exempt income generated under the Investment Law accumulated by the company until December&nbsp;31, 2011 (&#147;Trapped Earnings&#148;) is entitled to
	distribute a dividend from such income without being required to pay additional corporate tax with respect to such dividend. A company that has so elected must make certain qualified investments in Israel over five-year period. A company that has
	elected to apply the temporary tax relief cannot withdraw from its election.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-32
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage101"></A>

	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;12:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	TAXES ON INCOME (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:19%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On November&nbsp;11, 2013, the Company reached a settlement agreement with the Israeli Tax
	Authorities (&#147;ITA&#148;) which provided (i)&nbsp;the full settlement of all disputes with the ITA with respect to the tax years 2002 through 2011, and (ii)&nbsp;the release of all the Company&#146;s Trapped Earnings through the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2011. In accordance with the Investments Law and the temporary tax relief, the Company is obligated to invest approximately $&nbsp;111,000 during five years period in the following forms (i)&nbsp;production assets (as defined
	therein), (ii)&nbsp;research and development activities in Israel and/or (iii)&nbsp;employment payments for new employees (other than office holders) added after 2011. Any amount not invested in the five years period, should be paid at the end of
	the 5 years, linked to the Israeli CPI and bears 4% annual interest since the election date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Foreign Exchange Regulations:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:19%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the Foreign Exchange Regulations, Check Point Ltd.
	calculates its tax liability in U.S. Dollars according to certain orders. The tax liability, as calculated in U.S. Dollars is translated into New Israeli Shekels according to the exchange rate as of December&nbsp;31st of each year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Income taxes of non-Israeli subsidiaries:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Non-Israeli subsidiaries are taxed according to the
	tax laws in their respective countries of residence.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company does not provide deferred tax liabilities when it intends to reinvest
	earnings of foreign subsidiaries indefinitely. Undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries that are considered to be permanently reinvested amounted to $&nbsp;178,636 and unrecognized deferred tax liability related to such earning amounted to $
	27,909 as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-33
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;12:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	TAXES ON INCOME (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

	c.

	Deferred taxes reflect the net tax effects of temporary
	differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for income tax purposes. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company&#146;s deferred taxes were in respect of the
	following:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s subsidiaries in the U.S. have provided valuation allowance in respect of deferred tax
	assets resulting from carry forward of net operating loss related to excess tax benefits from options exercised prior to the adoption of ASC No.&nbsp;718.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Through December&nbsp;31, 2015, the U.S. subsidiaries had a U.S. federal loss carry-forward of approximately $&nbsp;531,643 expiring beginning
	2018, mainly resulting from tax benefits related to employees&#146; stock option exercises that can be carried forward and offset against taxable income. Excess tax benefits related to employee stock option exercises for which no compensation
	expense was recognized will be credited to additional paid-in capital when realized. Through December&nbsp;31, 2015, the U.S. subsidiaries had a U.S. state net loss carry forward of approximately $&nbsp;96,955, which expire between fiscal 2016 and
	fiscal 2024, and are subject to limitations on their utilization. Through December&nbsp;31, 2015, the U.S. subsidiaries had research and development tax credits of approximately $&nbsp;15,924, which expire between fiscal 2019 and fiscal 2034 and are
	subject to limitations on their utilization.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-34
</P>

	AND SUBSIDIARIES

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS

	thousands (except share and per share data)

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_44"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Substantially all the balance of unrecognized tax benefits, if recognized, would reduce the Company&#146;s annual effective tax rate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company recorded $&nbsp;7,534, $&nbsp;6,214 and $&nbsp;20,857, respectively
	for interest expense related to uncertain tax positions. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company had accrued interest liability related to uncertain tax positions in the amounts of $ 17,413 and $&nbsp;9,879, respectively, which is
	included within income tax accrual on the balance sheets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s U.S. subsidiaries file federal and state income tax returns
	in the U.S. All of the U.S subsidiaries&#146; tax years are subject to examination by the U.S. federal and most U.S. state tax authorities due to their carry forward tax losses and overall credit carry-forward position, except for Check Point Inc.
	that the assessment statue period for tax years 2005 through 2011 was expired.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company believes that it has adequately provided for
	any reasonably foreseeable outcomes related to tax audits and settlement. The final tax outcome of its tax audits could be different from that which is reflected in the Company&#146;s income tax provisions and accruals. Such differences could have a
	material effect on the Company&#146;s income tax provision and net income in the period in which such determination is made.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;13:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SHAREHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	General:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Ordinary shares confer upon their holders the right to receive notice to participate
	and vote in general meetings of the Company, and the right to receive dividends if declared.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dividends declared on ordinary shares will
	be paid in New Israeli Shekels. Dividends paid to shareholders outside Israel will be converted into U.S. dollars, on the basis of the exchange rate prevailing at the date of payment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Share repurchase:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January&nbsp;29, 2015, the Company&#146;s board of directors approved
	and authorized the repurchase of up to additional $&nbsp;1,500,000 of the Company&#146;s ordinary shares and not more than $250,000 per quarter. Under the share repurchase programs, share purchases may be made from time to time depending on market
	conditions, share price, trading volume and other factors and will be funded by available working capital. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company repurchased ordinary shares for an aggregate amount of $&nbsp;4,822,805. During 2015, 2014 and 2013
	the Company repurchased 12,032,899, 11,207,320 and 10,148,834 shares for an aggregate amount of $ 985,735, $&nbsp;764,543 and $&nbsp;537,829, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-37
</P>

<B>
	CHECK POINT SOFTWARE TECHNOLOGIES LTD.
</B>

<B>
	AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:1.0PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	U.S. dollars in
	thousands (except share and per share data)
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;13:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SHAREHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Stock Options, RSUs and PSUs:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2005, the Company adopted two new equity incentive plans,
	which were subsequently amended in January 2014: the 2005 United States Equity Incentive Plan and the 2005 Israel Equity Incentive Plan together are referred to as the Equity Incentive Plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the Equity Incentive Plans, the Company may grant options to employees, officers and directors at an exercise price equal to at least
	the fair market value of the ordinary shares at the date of grant and are granted for periods not to exceed seven years. The Company grants under the Equity Incentive Plans options, Restricted Stock Units (&#147;RSUs&#148;) and Performance RSUs
	(&#147;PSUs&#148;) and can also grant a variety of other equity incentives. Options granted under the Equity Incentive Plans generally vest over a period of four to five years of employment. Options, RSUs and PSUs that are cancelled or forfeited
	before expiration become available for future grants. The number of PSUs granted to sales employees is equal to the amount of compensation earned (based on the employee&#146;s level) divided by the fair value of the ordinary share at the grant date.
	RSUs and PSUs vest over a four year period of employment from the grant date. PSUs are subject to certain performance criteria; accordingly, compensation expense is recognized for such awards when it becomes probable that the related performance
	condition will be satisfied.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the Equity Incentive Plans, the Company&#146;s non-employee directors receive an automatic annual
	option grant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Following the amendments to the Equity Incentive Plans in January 2014, on December&nbsp;31st of each year, the number of
	Reserved and Authorized Shares under the Equity Incentive Plans shall be automatically reset to equal 10% of the number of ordinary shares issued and outstanding as of year-end. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 the number of ordinary shares reserved
	under the Equity Incentive Plans equals 17,490,152.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A summary of the Company&#146;s stock option activity and related information is as
	follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_48"></A>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="70%">
</TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="4%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

<B>
	Options&nbsp;in

	thousands
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;13:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SHAREHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The total intrinsic value of options exercised during the years 2015, 2014 and 2013 was $
	131,603, $&nbsp;89,957 and&nbsp;$&nbsp;90,352, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The weighted average fair values at grant date of options granted for the
	years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013; with an exercise price equal to the market value at the date of grant were $ 22.39, $&nbsp;19.55 and $&nbsp;16.17, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The options outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, have been separated into ranges of exercise price, as follows:
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The weighted average fair values at grant date of RSUs granted for the years ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 were $ 83.23, $&nbsp;65.08 and $&nbsp;48.64, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The total fair value of shares vested
	during the years 2015, 2014 and 2013 was $ 22,485, $&nbsp;18,414 and $&nbsp;17,738, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The weighted average fair values at grant date of PSUs granted for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and
	2014 were $ 83.48 and $64.03, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The total fair value of shares vested during 2015 was $ 1,523. During 2014 and 2013 no PSUs
	were vested.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 the Company had a commitment to grant PSUs at the value of up to $22,232.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had approximately $&nbsp;120,717 of unrecognized compensation expense related to non-vested stock
	options and non-vested RSUs and PSUs, expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 1.82 years and $ 9,879 of unrecognized compensation expense related to PSUs that will be fixed in number during 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	F-40

	AND SUBSIDIARIES

	NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED
	FINANCIAL STATEMENTS

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	NOTE&nbsp;13:-
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SHAREHOLDERS&#146; EQUITY (Cont.)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan (&#147;ESPP&#148;):
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company reserved a total of 6,000,000
	ordinary shares for issuance under the ESPP. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, 5,523,283 ordinary shares had been issued under the ESPP. Eligible employees may use up to 15% of their salaries to purchase ordinary shares but no more than 1,250 shares per
	participant on any purchase date. The ESPP is implemented through an offering every six months. The price of an ordinary share purchased under the ESPP is equal to 85% of the lower of the fair market value of the ordinary share on the subscription
	date of each offering period or on the purchase date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During 2015, 2014 and 2013, employees purchased 277,571, 312,588 and 354,487
	ordinary shares at average prices of $ 60.99, $&nbsp;51.48 and $&nbsp;42.14 per share, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 1996, the Company adopted an
	ESPP, which was subsequently amended in 2015. According to the amendments, commencing the purchase period that begins February&nbsp;1, 2016, 500,000 ordinary shares are authorized for issuance under the US ESPP and 1,000,000 ordinary shares are
	authorized for issuance under the rest of the world (ROW) ESPP.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with ASC No.&nbsp;718, the ESPP is compensatory and as such
	results in recognition of compensation cost. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company recognized $ 4,517, $&nbsp;4,187 and $&nbsp;3,973, respectively, of compensation expense in connection with the ESPP.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company operates in one reportable segment
	(see Note 1 for a brief description of the Company&#146;s business). The total revenues are attributed to geographic areas based on the location of the Company&#146;s channel partners which are considered as end customers, as well as direct
	customers of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	property and equipment, net as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, by geographic area:
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Property and equipment, net:
</P>
